header.title: Settings
header.description: Configure Postie to match your needs. All settings are automatically saved.
header.advanced_mode_description: Show advanced configuration options for fine-tuning

status.failed_to_load_configuration_description: Please check the configuration settings and try again.

alerts.configuration_error_description: There are critical issues with your configuration that prevent proper operation.
alerts.setup_required_description: Please configure the required settings to start using Postie.

general.title: General Settings
general.output_directory_description: Directory where processed files and NZB files will be stored for both manual uploads and watcher
general.info_description: This is a global setting that applies to both manual file uploads and automatic file watcher uploads. All processed files and generated NZB files will be saved to this location.
general.saved_success_description: Your general configuration has been saved successfully!
general.ui_preferences_description: Customize the appearance and language of the application interface
general.language_description: Select your preferred language for the interface
general.theme_description: Toggle between dark and light themes for better visibility
general.maintain_original_extension_description: When enabled, NZB files will be named as 'filename.ext.nzb'. When disabled, they will be named as 'filename.nzb'.

file_naming.title: File Naming Configuration
file_naming.saved_success_description: Your file naming configuration has been saved successfully!

nzb_compression.title: NZB Compression Configuration
nzb_compression.enable_description: Compress generated NZB files to reduce file size
nzb_compression.saved_success_description: Your NZB compression configuration has been saved successfully!

info.zstd_description: Fast compression with good ratios. Recommended levels: 1-3 for speed, 6-9 for balance, 15+ for maximum compression.
info.brotli_description: Excellent compression ratios but slower than zstd. Recommended levels: 1-4 for speed, 5-8 for balance, 9-11 for maximum compression.
info.zip_description: Universal compression format with wide compatibility. Recommended levels: 1-3 for speed, 6 for balance, 9 for maximum compression.
info.disabled_description: NZB files will be saved uncompressed. Enable compression to reduce file sizes.

connection_pool.title: Connection Pool Configuration
connection_pool.min_connections_description: Minimum number of connections to maintain in the pool
connection_pool.skip_providers_verification_on_creation_: Skip verifying server connectivity when creating the connection pool. Useful for faster startup times.
connection_pool.info_description: Manages the connections to your NNTP servers. A larger minimum connection count provides better performance but uses more resources.

watcher.title: File Watcher
watcher.description: Automatically monitors a directory for new files and uploads them when they meet the configured criteria. Files are queued for processing and moved to the global output directory after successful upload.
watcher.directories_description: Configure where the watcher monitors files for automatic uploads
watcher.watch_directory_description: Directory where new files will be monitored for automatic upload. Processed files will be moved to the global output directory.
watcher.check_interval_description: How often to scan for new files
watcher.size_threshold_description: Minimum accumulated size before batch processing
watcher.min_file_size_description: Minimum size of individual files to process
watcher.behavior_description: Configure how processed files should be handled
watcher.delete_original_file_description: Permanently removes source files from the watch directory after successful upload. Use with caution as this action cannot be undone.
watcher.posting_schedule_description: Define when the watcher is allowed to post files (24-hour format)
watcher.time_range_description: Define when the watcher is allowed to post files (24-hour format)
watcher.ignore_patterns_description: File patterns to ignore (uses glob syntax)
watcher.saved_success_description: Your file watcher configuration has been saved successfully!

par2.title: PAR2 Recovery Files
par2.enable_description: Generate recovery files for error correction and repair
par2.par2_path_description: Path to PAR2 executable or parpar
par2.temp_dir_description: Directory where PAR2 files are temporarily created during processing (uses system temp by default)
par2.temp_dir_placeholder: Leave empty for system temp directory
par2.volume_size_description: Size of each PAR2 volume file
par2.max_input_slices_description: Maximum number of input slices for processing

extra_options.title: Extra PAR2 Options
extra_options.description: Additional command-line arguments for PAR2 executable
extra_options.no_options: No extra options configured. Add custom PAR2 arguments if needed.

features.par2_files_allow_recovery_of_damaged_or_: PAR2 files allow recovery of damaged or missing files
features.redundancy_percentage_determines_how_muc: Redundancy percentage determines how much data can be recovered
features.higher_redundancy_better_recovery_but_la: Higher redundancy = better recovery but larger PAR2 files
features.volume_size_controls_how_par2_data_is_sp: Volume size controls how PAR2 data is split across files
features.extra_options_allow_fine_tuning_of_par2_: Extra options allow fine-tuning of PAR2 generation

par2.saved_success_description: Your PAR2 configuration has been saved successfully!
par2.disabled_message: PAR2 disabled: Recovery files will not be generated. This may make it difficult to repair damaged uploads.

post_check.title: Post Check Configuration
post_check.enable_description: Verify that articles are successfully uploaded and propagated after posting
post_check.check_delay_description: Delay before checking if articles are available (e.g., 10s, 30s, 1m)
post_check.max_reposts_description: Maximum number of times to retry posting if article check fails
post_check.info_description: Verifies article availability after upload to ensure successful propagation. May increase upload time but improves reliability.
post_check.saved_success_description: Your post check configuration has been saved successfully!

posting.title: Posting Configuration
posting.max_retries_description: Number of times to retry failed uploads
posting.throttle_rate_description: Upload speed limit in MB per second (0 = unlimited)
posting.group_policy_description: How to distribute files across newsgroups
posting.wait_for_par2_description: Wait for PAR2 files to be created before starting upload

obfuscation.none_description: None: Nothing will be obfuscated - all original filenames, subjects, and metadata preserved
obfuscation.partial_description: Partial: Subject & filename obfuscated, same Yenc filename for all articles, real posted date, consistent poster
obfuscation.full_description: Full: Subject & filename obfuscated, randomized Yenc filenames per article, randomized dates (within 6 hours), random poster per article, no NXG header

par2_obfuscation.none_description: None: PAR2 files will use original filenames and metadata
par2_obfuscation.partial_description: Partial: PAR2 files will have obfuscated subjects & filenames, but consistent metadata
par2_obfuscation.full_description: Full: PAR2 files will be fully obfuscated with randomized filenames and metadata

group_policy_options.each_file: Each File - Random group per file

headers.title: Post Headers
headers.default_from_description: Default From header (leave empty for random)

custom_headers.title: Custom Headers
custom_headers.description: Additional headers to include in posts

newsgroups.title: Newsgroups
newsgroups.description: Groups where files will be posted
newsgroups.info: Common newsgroups: alt.binaries.test (for testing), alt.binaries.misc, alt.binaries.multimedia. Choose groups appropriate for your content type.

posting.saved_success_description: Your posting configuration has been saved successfully!

post_upload_script.title: Post Upload Script
post_upload_script.enable_description: Execute a command after NZB file generation is complete
post_upload_script.command_description: Command to execute. Use {nzb_path} as placeholder for the NZB file path.
post_upload_script.timeout_description: Maximum time to wait for command execution

examples.title: Command Examples
examples.description: Use the placeholder for the NZB file path in your command.

post_upload_script.saved_success_description: Your post upload script configuration has been saved successfully!

queue.title: Queue Configuration
queue.database_type_description: Database system to use for the upload queue
queue.max_concurrent_uploads_description: Maximum number of simultaneous uploads from queue
queue.info: Upload Queue: Manages file uploads with persistence, retry logic, and concurrent processing.

server.no_servers_description: Add at least one NNTP server to start uploading.
server.connection_idle_timeout_description: How long connections can remain idle
server.validation_warning: ⚠️ Host and port are required for this server to work.
server.saved_success_description: Your server configuration has been saved successfully!

validation_errors.port_invalid: Server {number}: Valid port number is required (1-65535)

server.tip: Tip: Configure multiple servers for better redundancy and upload speeds. The application will automatically distribute uploads across all configured servers.
